position: Lean Six Sigma Master Black Belt
profiles:
Summary Industrial Engineer with Master of Business Administration and Finance (Honorary degree) that has extensive experience in Operational Excellence methodologies applied at corporate level. Certifications include Master Black Belt in Lean and Sigma at Intel, Lean Manufacturing Bronze and Business Process Management (BPM), achieving Savings for $10 million on NPV in the last 6 years. Sebastian is currently driving strategic projects/programs for the Human Recourses Intel division. • Project Manager for top strategic projects for Human Resource Corporate division, managing a global Project team in 8 different cities, Including Europe, Asia and Americas. Summary Accomplished and experienced professional with excellent abilities in management, six sigma/operational excellence, healthcare, drug development, project management, computer technology, training, and professional speaking. Summary Accomplished and experienced professional with excellent abilities in management, six sigma/operational excellence, healthcare, drug development, project management, computer technology, training, and professional speaking. Accomplished and experienced professional with excellent abilities in management, six sigma/operational excellence, healthcare, drug development, project management, computer technology, training, and professional speaking. Accomplished and experienced professional with excellent abilities in management, six sigma/operational excellence, healthcare, drug development, project management, computer technology, training, and professional speaking. Experience Lean Six Sigma Master Black Belt / Operational Excellence Manager Intel Corporation | Sales and Marketing May 2011  – Present (4 years 4 months) Chandler, AZ Lean Six Sigma Master Black Belt managing strategy, deployment, teams and consulting business leaders using broad knowledge of the Operational Excellence Methodologies (BPM, Lean Six Sigma, Agile, Innovation) within mulitiple organizations of Intel Corporation. Overall ROI savings (Intel Corporation): $62M Founder Infinitum Health, LLC July 2013  – Present (2 years 2 months) scottsdale, az Infinitum Health, LLC (www.infinitumhealth.com) was created to deliver a high quality holistic healthcare products. Our flagship products, Infinimin® (Ultravitamin) and Infiniderm® (Daily Youth Lotion), combines a base formulation with additional organic extracts proven by evidence based research for their anti-tumor, anti-viral, anti-inflammatory, anti-aging, and other immunstimulating effects. Infinitum Health's vision is to provide evidence based products to increase the overall health of the consumer. As Infinitum Health grows, we plan to have strong evidence-based research behind every product to help support its use, further its research, and expand its reach across the globe. We feel that by providing the evidence-based research to the consumer, they can be empowered and inform themselves on related health benefits. We look forward to collaborating with our consumer in providing a “healthful existence, forever, without limits.” Director of Business Improvement / Six Sigma Master Black Belt Apollo Group April 2010  –  May 2011  (1 year 2 months) Support, develop and nurture process excellence through coaching, training and mentoring of leaders and consultants at all levels on process improvement activities. Additionally, lead high impact global transactional and operational process improvement projects using appropriate Lean/Six Sigma methods to achieve project objectives that support Apollo and University of Phoenix’s Strategy. Quality Assurance and Regulatory Affairs Manager / Six Sigma Black Belt Covance Laboratories November 2008  –  March 2010  (1 year 5 months) Startup and manage the Covance Laboratories Quality Assurance group for the Chandler, AZ site. Staff and serve as the facility’s primary QA contact. Guide and manages Covance North America’s quality and continuous improvement staff to achieve maximum effectiveness in ensuring regulatory compliance, meeting customer needs, and achieving business results. Consult business units on compliance issues and issue resolution. Host client visits, FDA and associated regulatory agency visit, as well as maintaining site Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). Founder theBazaar.com January 2008  –  April 2009  (1 year 4 months) Madison, Wisconsin Area Electronics Drop Shipping firm - base clients for drop shipping process were Best Buy, Walmart, Circuit City. Key markets: United States, Japan, Taiwan. Thailand. Aided reducing operating WIP for all firms prior to public shelving of electronics products. (Sold Assets: 4/2009) Six Sigma Black Belt Covance December 2006  –  November 2008  (2 years) Responsible to leading business process improvement projects on a global scale. Mentor Green Belt projects to completion in addition to teaching Six Sigma training courses. Consult specific business units on multiple process and/or strategy concerns for improvement. Founder Wealth Weekly February 2006  –  October 2007  (1 year 9 months) Madison, Wisconsin Area Wealth-Weekly.com - weekly newsletter for targeted audience of young entrepreneurs looking to learn financial strategies, investing, and general business startup finance. Took 150 person subscriber base from original asset list to 14327 with 55% open rate of newsletters within 18 months. 
[Purchased Assets from YoungWealthWeekly.com (2006); Sold Wealth-Weekly.com assets 10/2007. Purchasing firm: Money.com] Supervisor, Toxicology Operations Covance March 2005  –  January 2007  (1 year 11 months) Manage a group of 10 technicians that have carried out 45 preclinical drug development phase studies on all approved animal models with a net contract revenue of $34,181,163. Involved in numerous process improvement projects with a total savings of $234,435 for the year of 2005. Maintain a national intranet site for >500 employees. Maintain budget, revenue, and efficiency data involved within the department. Train new employees on study management, write standard operating procedures (SOPs), and collaborate with the study direction staff on study protocol design. Perform corporate training sessions for new employees regarding “Drug Development”, “The Role of the Manager”, and “Animals and the Miracles of Medicine.” Founder Miragetemplates.com January 2005  –  March 2006  (1 year 3 months) Madison, Wisconsin Area "Creating optical phenomenons for web site™"  
Online Website Template shop for small and mid size businesses offering full website setup, editing, and launching tools. Sold Assets 2/2006, Purchasing Company: Templatemonster.com) Research and Development Technician/Key Trainer Covance February 2003  –  February 2005  (2 years 1 month) Carry out highly complex pharmaceutical and biotechnology studies on large animal species (non-human primates, canines, swine, and feline) while maintaining strong relationships with clients and upholding federal regulations for FDA approval. Mentor and train technical aspects of study technician to younger employees.
